title: Cameroon 2-0 Ghana: Calamity defending by Black Stars sees Indomitable Lions reach AFCON 2017 final
text:
Michael Ngadeu-Ngadjui's goal gave Cameroon a hard-fought lead (Photo: REUTERS) Share Get football   Thank you for subscribing!   
A Cameroon team criticised as being a long way off previous vintages booked their place in the final of the Africa Cup of Nations with a hard-fought win against a resolute Ghana side that was ultimately let down by a moment of poor collective defending. 
This much anticipated meeting between the Indomitable Lions and the Black Stars proved to be a cagey affair, which was perhaps not hugely surprising given the type of football that has so far characterised AFCON 2017. 
With a place in the final against tournament heavyweights Egypt up for grabs, it was Cameroon with the early initiative, after Ngadeu-Ngadjui saw his goalward-bound header cleared off the line by Harrison Afful. Jordan Ayew goes close to scoring for Ghana before Cameroon take the lead (Photo: AFP/Getty) The match ebbed and flowed, with chances at both ends punctuating what was mostly a game of attrition (Photo: REUTERS) Read More Cameroon vs Ghana: Total Shots Cameroon vs Ghana: Possession 
In a goalless first half at the Stade de Franceville Christian Bassogog also worked Black Star keeper Razah Brimah and Ghana could barely muster an attack in the opening 25 minutes as they scrambled to cope with sustained pressure on their defence. 
But Newcastle's Christian Atsu and Swansea's Jordan Ayew grew into the game as the half wore on, nearly combining to devastating effect when Ayew's shot whistled past Fabrice Ondoa's far post. 
After that, Ghana began to wrestle the initiative with Adolphe Teikeu nearly scoring an unwitting own goal on the stroke of half-after his looping back-header threatened to sail over Ondoa's head. Cameroon were forced to defend for large parts of the second half (Photo: AFP/Getty) Brimah Razak picks up a Spider-Man toy from the side of the pitch (Photo: REUTERS) Cameroon fans can now prepare for a final showdown with Egypt (Photo: REUTERS) Read More AFCON 2017 fixtures and results: Schedule and scores from the Africa Cup of Nations 
Ghana put Cameroon under increasing pressure as the second half wore on, but sloppy defending proved their undoing after conceding a cheap free-kick 25 yards from goal - when Ghana's John Boye found his clearance diverting to the back-post where a grateful Ngadeu-Ngadjui was waiting to dispatch the ball past Brimah. 
Ghana responded by taking the game to Cameroon, but their host of stars were unable to find a way to slay the Indomitable Lions. 
Hugo Broos' side removed any late doubt about the result in stoppage time, when Bassagog combined with Aboubakar on the counter, dinking the ball past Razak to spark rapturous celebrations.
